result.execSummary:
The defendant John C Fears was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. Restitution will be forwarded to the DA's office.

Remaining bail applied of $102.00. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Thomas M. or Home Depot.
Criminal Thinking or any other courses recommended.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

timeConds.notes: Conditition Time - (nonworking hours) Credit for 5 days. Standard release conditions. Sentence may be transferred to Milwaukee. No Electronic Monitoring.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant John C Fears in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense addresses restitution and requests a date after the 1st of July. Defendant needs to pay $398.00. Restitution addressed. Court passes this matter. Defense to fill out paperwork with his client. Case recalled. Parties proceed to plea/sentencing. Amended Information filed. Reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  7 months jail straight time STAYED for 12 months Probation - May be transferred to Milwaukee County
- Court Costs of $243.00 - BALANCE OF BAIL IN THE AMOUNT OF $102.00 TO BE APPLIED TO COURT COSTS and remainder to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $398.00 - APPLY $398.00 FROM BAIL THAT WAS POSTED - FORWARD TO DA'S OFFICE
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Thomas M. or Home Depot. Criminal Thinking or any other courses recommended.   DNA, surcharge is waived.
 -  35 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing June 15, 2015 by 6:00 p.m.. Credit for 5 days.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Sentence may be transferred to Milwaukee County - Court orders NO Electronic Monitoring.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
with same conditions

Attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg in court.   Defendant John C Fears did not appear.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not appear, case was set for 10:30, case was called at 10:55 a.m.  Based on defendant's non appearance, Court orders bail be revoked and forfieted.  Court issues capias.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg in court.   Defendant John C Fears did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense explains his client absence. There is a stayed capias. Court lifts the stay. Bail revoked and forfeited and capias to issue for Br. 9 only. Case recalled. Atty. Lowenberg appeared via phone. Defendant appeared in person. Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant explains why it took him so long to appear today. Court quashes the capias - not issued. Court reinstates bail - not forfeited. Defendant needs to pay restitution. Defense requests another date for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
